intro: Lomatogonium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Lomatogonium micranthum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
